p: Our comparisons of population characteristics of the amphitropical hippid crab, E. analoga, in Chile and California, revealed very similar overall macroscale patterns in body size of these populations. The body size of the largest males, smallest and largest ovigerous females, the size at maturity of females, and the mean size at settlement (megalopae) increased significantly ( P < 0.05) from lower to higher latitudes in both the southern and northern hemisphere (Figs 6A–6D; 7A) ( Table 2). In all comparisons, the slope of the observed relationship with latitude was steeper for populations of this crab in the northern hemisphere (>0.9) than the southern hemisphere (<0.35) ( Fig 6A–6D, Table 2).
